Reviews.Title: This kind of picture for under $300?
Reviews.Author: TonyK
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV for my room at school and my roommate and I decided on something in the 30-36" range. We found we could either get a refurbished model from a big brand like Sony or Sharp for about $220, or a new model from a no-name brand like Haier or others that I can't even remember then I found this model for about $270 with free shipping.In short:-The LED picture is stunning, the blacks are very deep and the colors aren't washed out like many Samsung models I've seen.-Standard definition TV programming looks pretty grainy, although the cable quality in my building isn't the best. Playing standard definition video games or watching standard definition DVDs looks very sharp and detailed.-It is only 720p but on a screen this size it doesn't make a huge difference.-Motion blur isn't good, it's refresh rate is only 60Hz, but it isn't annoying.-The settings assistant Philips uses makes it so easy to get a good picture setup from the start. They split the screen down the middle and show the same picture with different settings applied and you choose which looks better.-The Sound is really impressive, especially from a TV this size/cost and considering the speakers are mounted in the back. If you mess around with the equalizer and turn the bass up a bit you get a rich, clear sound.-Not that it matters for dorm living but its estimated energy usage is $6 a year based on watching 5 hours a day.-Finally, the touch-sensitive buttons on the front are really cool and they are very responsive.Overall this is a very high quality TV at an unbelievable price. Amazon has been ordering 15-20 at a time and selling out within a week. If it's in stock don't hesitate.

Reviews.Title: great for price
Reviews.Author: dominic richert
Reviews.Content: i bought this tv at Sams club for 280. the design is really nice i think. it works great in my bedroom with an xbox, cable, and a computer connected. the speakers are great. the picture is as good as any i have seen on tvs, especially when using it for a monitor

Reviews.Title: Great second room tv
Reviews.Author: Poetry in Motion
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with this tv. It has a bright and detailed picture and clear sound, allows even lower tones to be heard in movies that have a wide sound varience. I have only owned it for 1 month, so I can't speak to it's durability, but it seems as well made as any other flat screen in its price range that I have owned. I like the energy star features, and it has no annoying lights on the front panel -- an important feature for a bedroom tv.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: M1SA
Reviews.Content: All I use the tv for is for Gaming on the Xbox 360 and occasional movies. The picture is crisp and sharp. With an hdmi cable, the picture is epic. Most of these comments are rediculous. Rating the tv bad because you can't use a USB? Seriously? Who uses a tv for it's USB? Can't delete channels? Get direct tv or cable service.Get this tv. It's a great tv for its class and the price is right!

Reviews.Title: Deceptive Advertising: USB video playback does not work. Now I question if the tv will last
Reviews.Author: Traveler "Duke"
Reviews.Content: The Philips 32PFL4507 USB video playback is just marketing to get one to buy the TV.  The USB Video only supports an OLD and Unique format called Motion JPEG with AVI extension (MJPEG.AVI).  I downloaded 5 different free and paid video converters and none support the unique Philips video format.  I've sent emails to Philips and two different paid video converter software companies.  Will let all know if I get any resolution.  If I don't, I'll return this TV for a Samsung which cost more but has broad support for video playback.That said here are the following Pros:1. Outstanding picture contrast, sharpness, and quality2. Good audio...good base and choices for mixing3. Love the audio output jack!!!!  This tv is in bedroom so I just plug in my wireless headphones and bam I can play as loud as I want without waking the kids!!!!4. Light weight so setting on economy furniture not a problem5. can be wall mounted6. 3 HDMI inputs....for the price and quality this is unusual cause most only have 2 HDMIs7. Easy setup, but most TVs are now days8. Nice and easy screen setup steps that are all visual so what you see is what you get.July 10, 2012 UPDATEContacted Philips who stated they do not have the software and do not recommend converter software.I finally found software that does convert the files to MJPEG.avi 320 x 240....However the TV still comes up with "Format Not Supported."  I give up.Philips engaged in deceptive marketing of their video playback.  It does not work and not even Philips knows software that can make it work.Bottome line:  Don't buy.July 11, 2012 UPDATEFrom a phone call with Philips Technical rep:1.  How to "delete" channels:  While true one cannot "delete" a channel, one can "skip" any channel.  From the Menu, go to the "channel list," select the channel to skip, puts "OK" and it should fade.  Now exit out of the menu and scroll through your channels.  No "skip" channels appear.  It works great!2.  Technical rep said he had never tried to show video on the USB.  Said he would research.  He also suggested using a PC playback etc.  While I can to this, I don't want to since Philips states the video will playback.  Simply put, I want the thing to work as advertised.Now the Cons:1.  No video converter for the OLD and Unique video format: MJPEG with avi extension2.  No way to label inputs (note: Philips calls these "sources" on the remote)3.  USB port on back and side of the flat screen so if wall mounted make sure you get a USB extension4.  Audio jack also on the back and side so again not cool for wall mounted use5.  Since 60HZ, fast motion distortion can be seenMy reference for picture quality and sound include one Sony 55", two 42" Panasonic plasmas, one 32" Samsung LCD.  Of these, I still love the Sony!  Panasonics are great and Samsung very good.

Reviews.Title: An a-plus deal
Reviews.Author: Vera L. Price
Reviews.Content: Great tv for the price. Good picture quality. Set up was super easy. Nice bedroom size. The only downside is we can't figure out how to get it into full screen mode, so will have to call Philips about that

Reviews.Title: Great LED TV!
Reviews.Author: Lawless
Reviews.Content: The only complaint I really have is with the sound quality. The bass is not as rich as the other reviewers are making it out to be.Everything else is fine.Edit 4/11/2013: Okay ,this tv really needs a better sound card, my sub woofer is basically useless with this television.  If you love listening to music and watching music videos, this TV is not for you.  The sound quality is FLAT!!

Reviews.Title: Good value and great picture
Reviews.Author: S. M. Woods
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the price.  Cannot rename the source of input like other Philips. The quality of the picture is good.  The Sony media center remote sometimes likes to change the source on the TV which is very annoying.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: Pooja Bakshi
Reviews.Content: I really like this TV. A lot of the other reviews are correct where it says the volume isn't that great but the picture quality is great and for the price a great deal.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: D. Compton "Deb"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this for my in laws for Christmas. Had to set it up for them so gave it to them on Thanksgiving. They thought the picture was great. Today they finally gave up basic cable and went with digital. They are loving it. We have the same TV only 4 years older. We have not had on drop of trouble and the picture is as good now as when we got. it. This would be why we bought the in laws a philips. Great price at 269 as it was 50 cheaper than Costco and it was here fast. Everyone is happy and the tv sound and picture quality are good. If you need a good 32 in this is the way to go. It also fits in their old TV cabinet without any alterations to the wood, double bonus!

Reviews.Title: JUNK!!!!
Reviews.Author: Gregory W.
Reviews.Content: Phillips TV's are all GARBAGE!!!!  Bought (2) 55" TV's and both broke down with the same malfunction.  I understand Phillips TV's all have the same problems ...... Go figure!!  Cost more to repair than replace.  JUNK!!!!  Run as fast as you can away from this brand.

Reviews.Title: Approx 12 months from date of purchase the screen went ...
Reviews.Author: Bonnie J.  McMillan
Reviews.Content: Approx 12 months from date of purchase the screen went black. Set was used 6 hours a day. Would never buy a Phillips tv again

Reviews.Title: Philips..
Reviews.Author: Ilko G. Iliev "I. Iliev"
Reviews.Content: The human eye cannot detect for real the difference between 60 and 120 Hz picture. If you are not picky this TV will completely satisfy your requirements, needs,and budget. I am so happy to have this TV in my guest bedroom. The item is really great. It came very well packed, no damages on the box or TV. Excellent and very fast shipment. I love it and strongly recommend seller.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Claudia Lairet
Reviews.Content: It came in perfect condition, brand new and sealed, the screen is perfect and the quality is amazing. great product.

Reviews.Title: great HMID and VGA Monitor for the price.
Reviews.Author: Marc I. Cohen "what?"
Reviews.Content: I'm rocking two different computers on this thing and it kicks but... and not at the same time for you smart asses.Great color contrast, brightness sure size. I think I sit to close to it though. Very happy with this purchase. It really gives you a clear picture.

Reviews.Title: Nice and thin and easy on the power
Reviews.Author: Lincoln Hansen "The Link"
Reviews.Content: Again got this to go in our 5th wheel trialer to upgrade the tube tv. It is much lighter and sips the electricity fso it is a no brainer for this application. Very impressed with picture as well.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture, great value
Reviews.Author: Elyse Dubin
Reviews.Content: Can't do better for the money.  I like the picture and the sound better than my much more expensive Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Roberta L. Salmon "obxbert"
Reviews.Content: Purchased for our home office.  Picture is great and works perfectly.  Even our son who only wants "the best of the best" admitted it was a great TV.

Reviews.Title: A great t.v. with room for improvement.
Reviews.Author: Yasin
Reviews.Content: This is a great T.V. for a great price. The resolution is amazing on this telvision. There is very little difference between a 1080p and a 720p screen on a  32". However this T.V. has room for improvement. Although, it has a USB port video playback via USB with certain formats. Also the USB and audio input are on the backside of the T.V., which if mounted on a wall, makes it very hard to use. Many manufactures place their inputs on the side of the T.V. But for the price of the T.V. nothing can beat it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!..
Reviews.Author: Adrian Agreda
Reviews.Content: I don't have any complain about this TV, i love it!.. it is perfect, great image, good sound, so many options and settings, 100% recommended.

Reviews.Title: Streaming of content from MAC PC does not work
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: Great TV visually, but the streaming of content from MACs does not work.  It is advertised as having this capability on the box and in the specs.  The software downloads and installs, but the streaming doesn't work.  Spent on hour online with Philips support, and they confirmed that the streaming with MACs is not working and "they are fixing the software".  Now I am left with a TV no better than the one I replaced, even though I spent the money.  You can confirm on the online forums that this is a consistent problem.  Wished I had checked them ahead of time.

Reviews.Title: fantastic at first
Reviews.Author: bmaze
Reviews.Content: this tv has a fantastic crystal clear picture. the sound is adequate but if your into watching movies you will want to hook a stereo up to this tv. there is only so much sound you can get out of these new led tvs because they are so thin they cant put bigger speakers in them. if you know anything about the laws of physics and sound movement then it makes perfect sense. i compared the magnavox and vizio led tvs in this price range and the picture on this philips was the winner.UPDATE...after a week with this tv i returned it for a vizio lcd. i noticed 2 dead pixels on the screen which should have been picked up during quality control in the factory. i also started noticing black levels with flashlights and clouds and blooming which equals poor black levels. Backlight uniformity issues make LCD/LED a poor option right now as i noticed after having this tv for a week. i will wait a year or 2 until the led technology gets perfected before making a purchase.

Reviews.Title: STAY AWAY - DO NOT BUY FROM PHILIPS
Reviews.Author: Charles
Reviews.Content: A letter to Philips regarding my 40PFL3706Dear Philips Entitlement Department.How telling that I am writing to a "Department" and have not had the courtesy to deal with a person that would take some sort of real responsibility in caring for a Philips customer and ensuring that the customer is left satisfied and happy with their product.Frankly, I've never thought much of Philips as a brand, good nor bad.And now, after an incredibly distasteful experience I have quite an impression.The Philips brand is now engrained in my mind as a company whose product is I should steer clearly away from and one I should warn my friends and family to stay away from.And if anyone crosses my path that insists on buying Philips, I will surely warn them of the sneaky warranty that qualifies a factory certified "remanufactured" product as a replacement.To get a new product that has problems upon coming out of its package is disappointing enough, but to then to go through hoops to resolve the issue with a customer service department that is completely detached from its end user is exhausting, frustrating, and a waste of time.How pathetic that your warranty does not view "cosmetic damage - as incompletion of the warranty". What does that mean?That's like saying that you buy a brand new car to find out that their are issues with the motor and so you return it to get a new car and you are given a car that has a motor that works but the doors are keyed and scratched.At this point, I look forward to the first opportunity to replace my Philips TV simply just not to have the reminder of this ridiculous experience in my living room.

Reviews.Title: NO DVD/BLU-RAY INCLUDED
Reviews.Author: Readsalot
Reviews.Content: Information given for this TV does not tell you the slot for DVD/Blu-ray disks is not included. So you better have one or plan to buy one if you get this TV. Waste of money,

Reviews.Title: Lightweight In More Ways Than One
Reviews.Author: Music Lover 80
Reviews.Content: I just bought this TV and within a few minutes of hanging it on the wall I hated it.  The good points:  small, lightweight, intuitively obvious to operate, decent picture.  The bad points: everything else.  The TV has a USB port on the back that supposedly supports video playback via Motion JPEG (30 fps, 320X240) and JPEG viewing, although for the life of me I could never get the video to play ANYTHING...and I tried several different video formats (avi, mpeg, flv, etc.), including Motion JPEG avi files.  NOTHING WORKED.  Motion JPEG? REALLY?!!!!  Does anyone know ANYONE who uses this format?  My next pet peeve is that you can't delete channels you don't want to watch.  What?  This TV was designed and constructed in 2012 and you can't delete channels from the channel list?  Who made this TV?  A caveman?  If all you want/need is a small TV with a decent picture that changes volume and channels (i.e., the most basic TV on Earth), this puppy is for you...but if you want a TV that does even a little more, you'd be better off buying a refrigerator.  Avoid this TV like the plague, because it's a turkey and there HAVE to be many more TVs in its price range that offer more features.

ProductInfo.Features:
LED
Digital Crystal Clear
3 HDMI
SRS TruSurround
DLNA
ProductInfo.Name: Philips 32PFL4507 32-Inch 60Hz LED TV (Black) (2012 Model)
